document_data.name: Kordin
document_data.nicknames: Alley Cat Kordin{{Cite card/AD&D Trading Cards/1992|347|Alley Cat Kordin}}
document_data.refs2e: Kordin's card gives his class as "Rogue", which is a generic class group encompassing [[Thief|Thieves]] and [[Bard]]s. Since Kordin is described as a burglar, this article assumes his actual class to be Thief.
document_data.mainbody: '''Kordin''', more commonly known as '''Alley Cat Kordin''', was a [[human]] cat burglar in [[Tantras]].
document_data.Description: Kordin clad himself in all black, save for a pair of leather boots and a leather belt pouch. He had shoulder-length brown hair streaked with gray, and a gray mustache.
document_data.Personality: As a total lackwit, Kordin was constantly concocting improbable, seriously flawed schemes. He suffered from a serious case of bad luck, made worse by his inadequate intellect.
document_data.Possessions: Kordin owned a pair of ''[[slippers of spider climbing]]'', but they did little to improve his burglaring abilities.
document_data.Activities: All of Tantras knew him by the nickname "Alley Cat Kordin", owing to his poor luck and ineptitude. Although he sought recognition for his career as a cat burglar, Kordin would rather people forget about that unfortunate sobriquet.
